page.title: 17St.Mary's Youth Group
page.content: {St.Mary's Youth Group}opens every other Monday in the Old Village Hall from 7-9 pm. The membership is open to anybody of{secondary school age.}Most members have some connection with St. Mary's which is the parish church of the village. Those attending the group usually number 20 to 30 young people. The programme consists of such{ {activities}as table-tennis, snooker, playing records, stoolball, ten-pin bowling, ice-skating, rounders, visits to local places of interest and discussion sessions. In the summer the group have barbeques. In November they have a bonfire and fireworks with hot-dogs and jacket potatoes to eat. Just recently the Youth Group has begun to meet on the 'free' week in leader's homes for discussion of topics with a{religious aspect.}
